The summer of 2020 was particularly hot in Canada. Temperatures in the country were around 30°C on average, with some places hitting over 40°C.

The summer of 2020 was a scorcher across Canada, a country not typically known for its sizzling heat. With the sun blazing down relentlessly, average temperatures hovered around a toasty 30°C, with some areas experiencing a blistering 40°C and beyond. It was a season where heatwaves became the norm, turning the usually cool Canadian landscape into a sun-drenched haven, pushing people to seek solace in shady retreats and refreshing bodies of water.
